history.content: No reason not to! You can also ask for extensions on interviews if you don't feel like you are ready, but that's something you can decide later. I'm also pretty sure FB is on 6-month delay for each individual role.

children.subject: I would like to add that most interviews are a crapshoot anyway. I think you could get the referral and if something does not work out, you can get another next year!

history.content:
I'm a junior and I have a cousin working at facebook and he said there they are still recruiting product engineering interns and ask me whether I want him to refer me.

I'm a bit scared because I don't think my leetcode ability is high enough, and I don't think I know enough about linux. He said it's just gonna be the basics but I still don't know..

I've already gotten an intership at a medium sized startup btw. I'm a bit scared that if I get rejected this time, I'll be frozen until next december, which means I'll miss the fall recruitment for new grads. Should I ask him to do this? Thanks!!
history.subject: Should I get a referral for facebook product engineering role?
